{{Infobox political party | country = Ukraine | party_name = Yuriy Lutsenko's People's Self-Defense (People's Self-Defense) | name_native = ÐÐ°ÑÐ¾Ð´Ð½Ð° Ð¡Ð°Ð¼Ð¾Ð¾Ð±Ð¾ÑÐ¾Ð½Ð° Ð®ÑÑÑ ÐÑÑÐµÐ½ÐºÐ° | party_logo = [[File:People's Self-defence logo.png|100px]] | leader = [[Yuriy Lutsenko]] | foundation = April 13, 2007 | ideology = | international = ''None'' | european = | position = | colours = Dark Red and White | colorcode = | headquarters = [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]] | website = http://www.nso.org.ua/ua/about }}
The '''Yuriy Lutsenko's People's Self-Defense''' ({{lang-uk| ÐÐ°ÑÐ¾Ð´Ð½Ð° Ð¡Ð°Ð¼Ð¾Ð¾Ð±Ð¾ÑÐ¾Ð½Ð° Ð®ÑÑÑ ÐÑÑÐµÐ½ÐºÐ°}}) is a [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] [[electoral bloc]].
In the [[Ukrainian parliamentary election, 2007|parliamentary elections]] on 30 September 2007, the bloc was part of the [[Our UkraineâPeople's Self-Defense Bloc|Our Ukraine]] alliance, that won 72 out of 450 seats.
[[Yuriy Lutsenko]] is the party leader.
==History== The electoral bloc was created on April 13, 2007 and was based on the [[Civil Movement "People's Self-Defense"|civil movement]] that was created several months earlier. The bloc consists of two parties ''[[Forward, Ukraine!]]'' and ''[[Christian Democratic Union (Ukraine)|Christian-Democratic Union]]''. It participated in the [[Ukrainian parliamentary election, 2007|parliamentary elections]] of 2007 later forming a deputy group within the [[Our UkraineâPeople's Self-Defense Bloc|Our Ukraine]] alliance.
In July 2007, the old [[Our Ukraine bloc]] had been reorganized with Civil Movement "People's Self-Defense" into the [[Our UkraineâPeople's Self-Defense Bloc]] for the [[Ukrainian parliamentary election, 2007|2007 parliamentary election]] in September 2007.<ref>{{cite news|title=10 parties signed declaration on creating united democratic forces bloc|url=http://www.unian.net/eng/news/news-202196.html|work=The Jameston Foundation|date=July 5, 2007|accessdate=2007-10-02}}</ref> The member parties had planned to merge into a single party in December 2007<ref>{{cite news|title=New bloc backs Ukraine president|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/6929336.stm|work=The Jameston Foundation|date=August 3, 2007|accessdate=2007-10-02}}</ref> but on November 16, 2007 [[Peopleâs Self-Defense]] decided to end its participation in the process of forming a united party<ref>[http://www.pravda.com.ua/en/news/2007/11/16/9443.htm Lutsenko Refuses to Join New NU-NS Party / Ukrayinska Pravda<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> since then that process is unclear<ref>[http://www.razom.org.ua/en/news/20086/ News Site RAZOM<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>. The alliance currently holds 72 out of 450 parliamentary seats.
The party's parliamentary faction did not support the dismissal of the [[second Tymoshenko Government]].<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/60828/ People's Self-Defense to enter 'opposition to Yanukovych,' says Lutsenko], [[Kyiv Post]] (March 2, 2010)</ref>
In an interview with the Silski Visti (Village News) newspaper on January 29, 2009 Yuriy Lutsenko declared that ''The [[Civil Movement "People's Self-Defense"|People's Self-Defense]] as an insurgent, protesting, and not very structured civil movement has ceased to exist''. Lutsenko also said he was planning to direct the organizational changes to the political party [[Forward, Ukraine!]].<ref>[http://www.interfax.com.ua/eng/main/6595/ Interior minister planning to set up full-fledged political force], [[Interfax|Interfax-Ukraine]] (29-01-2009)</ref> In April 2010 Forward, Ukraine! renamed itself [[People's Self-Defense Political Party]].<ref name=namegame>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/64605/ Forward, Ukraine! Party changes name to People's Self-Defense], [[Kyiv Post]] (April 21, 2010)</ref> Lutsenko became leader of that party.<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/98630/print/ Prosecutor's office refuses to release Lutsenko on bail, says People's Self-Defense], [[Kyiv Post]] (March 1, 2011)</ref>
==Current parliamentarians== * [[Volodymyr Aryev]] * [[Oleksandr Doniy]] * [[Yuriy Hrymchak]] * [[Hennadiy Moskal]] * [[Viktor Shemchuk]] * [[Yuriy Stets]] * [[Taras Stetskiv]]
===Former parliamentarians=== The following deputies where expelled from the [[Our UkraineâPeople's Self-Defense Bloc]] fraction in September 2011 because of supporting the [[Azarov Government]].<ref name="expelledfromOUPDSSept2011">[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/112326/ People's Self-Defense faction: Twelve parliamentarians expelled from Our Ukraine], [[Kyiv Post]] (September 7, 2011)</ref> * [[Oleh Novikov]] * [[Oleksandr Omelchenko]] * [[Kateryna Lukyanova]] * [[Serhiy Vasylenko]] * [[Volodymyr Marushchenko]] * [[Serhiy Kharovsky]]
[[Oleksandr Bobyliov]] became a member of [[Reforms for the Future]] in 2010.<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/100063/ Parliament to probe past gas deals], [[Kyiv Post]] (March 17, 2010)</ref>
